p: This study also revealed the variation of edaphic factors (soil pH and nutrient status) in the four locations. Soil actual pH (pH H 2O) from Bogor and Pasuruan were relatively neutral (6–7) and significantly higher than those from Tulungagung and West Bandung ( Table 4). West Bandung soil was consistently more acidic. Soil potential pH showed a significant and positive correlation (α 1%) to the soil actual pH, soil organic carbon (C-organic) and soil nitrogen total (N total) ( Table 5). The highest pH in the Bogor soil was associated with the highest C-organic and N total. This finding highlighted the role of soil organic matter as a buffer to soil pH, leading to preserve soil C and N pool [ 38].
